title: Ticket #851: New DAGMan lazy log file code has a problem with rescue DAGs
description:
(See RUST ticket.)

It seems like something in the new lazy log file code is not handling things correctly with rescue DAGs. I'm still working on narrowing it down.
remarks:
Okay, this is now fixed for 7.4.0, and the fix is merged all the way back to the trunk. I'm leaving the ticket open because I need to document the fix, and also add a test, but I guess I'll downgrade it to priority 2... wenger 2009-10-14.

This is now documented, and there's also a corresponding test, so I'm resolving this ticket. wenger 2009-10-16.
check_ins:
2009-Oct-27 17:26   Check-in [25085]: Added a note about the rescue DAG problem (gittrac #851) to the 7.3.2 version history. (By Kent Wenger )
2009-Oct-16 15:55   Check-in [25039]: Documented gittrac #851 (New DAGMan lazy log file code has a problem with rescue DAGs) fix in version history. (By Kent Wenger )
2009-Oct-16 15:04   Check-in [16106]: Added new job_dagman_rescue-A test (tests the rescue DAG problem noted in gittrac #851). (By Kent Wenger )
2009-Oct-14 19:57   Check-in [16058]: Fixed gittrac #851 (New DAGMan lazy log file code has a problem with rescue DAGs) -- the problem was a mixup between bootstrap and recovery modes in Dag::TerminateJob(). (By Kent Wenger )
creator: wenger
